titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Records of the Office of Budget and Resource Planning
1980-2002
RG 11 RG.11
titlestmt.author: Processed by University Archives staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-14 08:39:15 -0500.

change.item: Updated by Craig Savino to reflect Accession 06-013 and Accession 07-001.

did.unittitle: Records of the Office of Budget and Resource Planning

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Office of Budget and Resource Planning

did.abstract: The responsibilities of the Office of Vice President for Budget and Resources include review and oversight of the budgets of all schools and departments. The four main areas of the office are: Academic Facilities, Planning and Construction, Real Estate, and the Office of the University Architect. This office is also in charge of NYU Bookstore and all ID card offices. The records in the collection are the administrative files of Dr. Bing.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged by their account numbers
The files are grouped into 1 series:

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: There is no information about materials that are associated by provenance to the described materials that have been physically separated or removed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records of the Office of Vice President for Budget and Resource Planning are the administrative files of Dr. Richard Bing. The files pertain to renovations, relocation, and maintenance for NYU buildings. The files are arranged by their account numbers.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Office of Vice President for Budget and Resource Planning was created in the early 1980s with the appointment of Dr. Richard Bing. The responsibilities of the Office include review and oversight of the budgets of all schools and departments. The four main areas of the office are: Academic Facilities, Planning and Construction, Real Estate, and the Office of the University Architect. The office is also in charge of the NYU Bookstore and all ID card offices. The name of the Office was changed in November 2003 to the Office of Public Resource Administration and Development.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Office of Budget and Resource Planning; RG 11; box number; folder number;
New York University Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
New York University Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2646
Fax: (212) 995-4070
E-mail: university-archives@nyu.edu

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Institutional records of New York University are closed for a period of 20 years from the date of their creation (the date on which each document was written). Board of Trustees records are similarly closed for 35 years from the date of creation. The opening date for files spanning several years will be 20 years from the most recent date. Access will be given to material already 20 years old contained within a collection that is not yet open when such material can be isolated from the rest of the collection.

Materials related to personnel, faculty grievances, job searches and all files with information that falls under the University's Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) policy are permanently restricted.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Office of Budget and Resource Planning
